alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 9:13PM EDT until July 02 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cecil County in northeastern Maryland... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 913 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cecilton, or 11 miles west of Middletown, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Cecilton, Warwick, Bohemias Mills and Cayots. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
